searchDocs.title: Welcome
searchDocs.content: Docusaurus blogging features are powered by the blog plugin. Simply add Markdown files (or folders) to the blog directory. Regular blog authors can be added to authors.yml. The blog post date can be extracted from filenames, such as: 2019-05-30-welcome.md2019-05-30-welcome/index.md A blog post folder can be convenient to co-locate blog post images: The blog supports tags as well! And if you don't want a blog: just delete this directory, and use blog: false in your Docusaurus config.

searchDocs.title: Move üö∂ ‚Äì 1-3 AP‚Äã
searchDocs.content: You can move 1 step distance for each action point spent.  You can move less that step distance up to 0 if desired (moving for 0 means just changing position), the whole point would be spent anyway.  If you spend 3 action points to move in one direction (30 degree turns or less) you are considered running. Your step is increased by 1 next turn. You stop running as soon as you stop moving full step each move action.  You can change position for one level per move action for free. As a special case you can fall down from any position making you prone but not the other way around.  Positions StandingCrouchingSittingProne

searchDocs.title: Melee ‚öîÔ∏è‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Expertise in combat using melee weapons such as swords, clubs, and axes. This skill encompasses techniques for both offensive and defensive maneuvers, understanding weapon reach, and exploiting weaknesses in an opponent's defense. Masters of melee combat are often trained in various weapon types and fighting styles.

searchDocs.title: Brawl üëä‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Skill in hand-to-hand combat, including martial arts, boxing, and wrestling. This involves striking, grappling, and using the environment to one's advantage. Brawlers are adept at close-quarters combat, leveraging their physical strength and agility to subdue opponents without the use of weapons.

searchDocs.title: Ranged üèπ‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Proficiency with all ranged weaponry available at the current tech level, including bows, firearms, energy weapons and all kinds of artillery. This skill covers aiming, shooting, and maintaining ranged weapons, as well as understanding projectile trajectories and environmental factors that affect accuracy. Skilled marksmen can hit targets at varying distances with precision.

searchDocs.title: Tactics üåÆ‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Ability to devise and execute strategic plans, find advantageous positions, and outsmart enemies in small group combat. This skill covers understanding battlefield dynamics, coordinating team movements, and exploiting enemy weaknesses. Tactical thinkers can turn the tide of a skirmish with clever strategies and effective leadership.

searchDocs.title: Crafting üõ†Ô∏è‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Skill in creating, repairing, and maintaining various items, including weapons, tools, and machinery. This includes understanding materials, construction techniques, and the use of specialized tools. Craftsmen can produce custom items and perform intricate repairs that keep equipment in optimal condition.

searchDocs.title: Technology üíæ‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Knowledge and proficiency in using and understanding the technical aspects of the world, including computers, electronics, explosives and advanced machinery. This skill covers programming, hacking, and operating complex systems. Technologically adept individuals can manipulate digital environments and innovate new technological solutions.

searchDocs.title: Medicine ‚öïÔ∏è‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Ability to provide first aid, perform surgery, and possess general medical knowledge for treating injuries and illnesses. This skill covers diagnosing conditions, administering treatments, and understanding medical procedures. Medical professionals can save lives and maintain the health of a group in various situations.

searchDocs.title: Survival ‚õ∫‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Ability to survive in the wilderness, including skills in foraging, taming animals, navigating, and building shelter. This skill encompasses knowledge of edible plants, tracking, and weather prediction. Survivalists can thrive in harsh environments and provide for themselves and others using natural resources.

searchDocs.title: Science üî¨‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Understanding of academic science and general knowledge in fields such as biology, chemistry, physics, and more. This skill allows individuals to conduct experiments, analyze data, and apply scientific principles to solve problems. Scientists can innovate new technologies and understand the natural world at a fundamental level.

searchDocs.title: Athletics üëü‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Physical prowess and capability in activities requiring strength, endurance, agility, and coordination. This skill includes running, jumping, swimming, and climbing. Athletes can perform feats of physical endurance and dexterity, making them invaluable in situations requiring quick movement and physical challenges.

searchDocs.title: Driving üöò‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Ability to operate all kinds of vehicles, from cars and motorcycles to boats and aircraft. This skill covers vehicle control, respective navigation, and maintenance. Skilled drivers can perform high-speed maneuvers, evade pursuers, and handle various terrains and weather conditions.

searchDocs.title: Stealth ü•∑‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Skill in hiding, concealing objects or actions, and performing tasks without being detected. This includes moving silently, using cover, and avoiding surveillance. Stealthy individuals can infiltrate secure areas, gather intelligence, and execute tasks without drawing attention.

searchDocs.title: Talking üó£Ô∏è‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Ability to effectively communicate, lie, persuade, detect lies, and threaten others. This skill includes understanding body language, tone, and context to influence and read people. Charismatic individuals can sway crowds, negotiate deals, and uncover hidden motives through conversation.

searchDocs.title: Social üóø‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Knowledge of social norms, etiquette, and customs, as well as understanding social dynamics and interactions. This skill allows individuals to navigate complex social situations, build and maintain relationships, and understand the subtleties of social hierarchies and traditions.

searchDocs.title: Lore üìö‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Knowledge of religious, mystical, and occult practices, beliefs, and lore. This skill involves understanding rituals, interpreting omens, and interacting with supernatural forces. Practitioners of occultism can perform magical rituals, summon entities, and gain insight into hidden mysteries.

searchDocs.title: Arts üé®‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Knowledge and skill in performing and creating in any chosen artistic field, such as music, painting, writing, and acting. This skill includes creative expression, technical proficiency, and an understanding of artistic traditions. Artists can evoke emotions, tell stories, and create works that inspire and entertain.

searchDocs.title: Driving actions‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Only one driving action can be performed per turn. After executing the driving action vehicle will perform movement instantly. If no driving moves are made during the driver's turn, the vehicle becomes uncontrolled.  Uncontrolled vehicle While the vehicle is in an uncontrolled state it keeps moving in direction it had before control was lost. Perform an ‚Äúinteract‚Äù action that costs 3 AP to try to take control of the vehicle. Roll against driving skill. On success, the vehicle becomes controlled again.

searchDocs.title: OUR principles:‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Simplicity. We do not overcomplicate things yet try to provide as much clarity in rules as possibleOpenness. Anyone can contribute to this system, modify it or use it for any purposes, commertial or notModularity. System should be extensible. Extension rules should come naturally for roleplaying system.Configurability. Our system can easily be customised for YOUR game. Any mechanic can be deepened if needed.Consistency. Rules should be logical and realistic enough to not feel unnatural. But mainly they must be simple to memorise and use.

searchDocs.title: Is OURS good for beginners in TTRPGS?‚Äã
searchDocs.content: OURS is perfect for beginner Players and Game Masters because it dosen't enforce a whole lot of rules. Core rules can be read just in 10 minutes and you're good to go.

searchDocs.title: Is OURS good for X setting?‚Äã
searchDocs.content: OURS provides generalized rules that are easily adaptable for any setting. You can even add new mechanics as you go!

searchDocs.title: Why should I switch to OURS?‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Even if you are happy with your current system, you should concider trying out OURS. It's easy to learn and completely free. OURS can do many things other systems just were not designed for.

searchDocs.title: What attribute and skill to use?‚Äã
searchDocs.content: OURS has quite a lot of attributes and skills event not concidering user defined ones. With 8 attributes and 18 skills in the base set, there are many possible combinations. So sometimes it's quite difficult to determine whitch combination to use.  Listen to what Player wants to do and ask exacly how would he do that. Then you should use the first combination that comes to your head. It would probably be ok. If player disagrees with your combination, listen what he thinks is the right combination to use and ask him to explain why this combintaion can be applied. The final word on what combination to use is after Game Master.  If a player wants to impress someone in a conversation, they might use Talking + Charisma Because chracter talks so nicely and beautiful that NPC would certanly be impressed! Talking + Wits Because chracter uses NPC's weak spots and tries to flatter them. Social + Intelligence Because chracter knows how things in this region are done. Athletics + Composure Because chracter impresses NPC without any words. Only their cold, strong, dangerous presense. There are many other possible combinations. Feel free to be creative as Player and as GM

searchDocs.title: Difficulty modifier‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Depending on the situation some tasks might be harder or easier to do. That's why difficulty modifier (or simly DM) is needed. It is just a number that is substituted from effective skill. The higher the DM is the less your chances of succeeding are.  Difficulty modifier is highly situational. The main things to condider DM are:  Complexity of the taskSkill and Attribute that character uses (some combinations might work worse in given situation. E.g. some NPCs might not be susceptible to threats)Background of character (e.g. character grew up in this village)  Difficulty	DMCasual	-1 or less Moderate	0 Tangible	1-2 Challenging	3-6 Hard	7-9 Impossible	10+

searchDocs.title: Criticals‚Äã
searchDocs.content: If sum on your dice roll does not exceed 6, then it is considered a critical success. Basically it means what whatever you tried to do, was done exceptionally well. And otherwise, if your roll exceeds 27 then it is a critical failure and was done terribly.
